reasoning: Subcortical infarction represents ~20-30% of all ischemic strokes. Using stroke incidence of 95 per 100k person-years (WHO 2005 estimate) multiplied by 0.30 subcortical proportion yields ~28.5 per 100k. Anatomically specific subtype with well-defined vascular territories (basal ganglia, thalamus, internal capsule).
source: WHO Global Burden of Disease 2005, stroke epidemiology estimates
